Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2009 12:21PM SandiH wrote: wbts, Like you I am new at this, Mammo and Ultrasound last week, scheduled for Biopsy this Wed. I trusted my gut to switch to a new GYN doc for my July GYN appt and he is the one who found my lump - breast exam (I had felt it also). Other symptoms for me is, swollen neck sometimes, didn't think it was anything to worry about, since I told my Intern Doc in February (who also did a breast exam), and he said it's nothing. Now, it could very well be nothing, but just having someone feel and say so, isn't good enough. Glad you're seeing someone else. Always trust your gut. Keeping you in my thoughts.

Posts.Title: swollen lymph nodes and puffy armpit wbts Troya78

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 12:06PM - edited Aug 18, 2009 12:06PM by SandiH wbts, I had the Ultrasound after getting the Mammo (by the Radiologist Tech) and the Radiologist did it again after reviewing those. The whole appt. time was about 2 hours. It was the Radiologist that recommended the Biopsy. So I have it tomorrow. When I asked if it was on the last mammo report, she did say, it was detectable with a mammo. So I think it was the Ultrasound that was the main reason for the Biopsy. I would also say to the Radiologist, Peace of Mind is worth more to you than cost and time of doing the Ultrasound, and if it was their mother, wife or daughter would they do the Ultrasound? Good Luck.
Posts.Title: swollen lymph nodes and puffy armpit wbts Troya78

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2009 12:54AM SandiH wrote: Hi Ladies, I had the Biopsy today, and let me be honest with you, it was virtually painless, just a little pressure, but not pain (the Mammo has more pressure). It's been about 4 hours now and it is just a little tender, no worse than a bruise. So for all of you having to have it done, the anticipation is the "real" pain. What I will say is, don't take Omega (Fish Oil). I had to wait to have the Biopsy done because I had taken aspirin, but they never asked about my Vitamins. After I had it done, I had a little bleeding (like you poked your finger). She asked if I was taking Omega, and I have been. She said that was why, and also said I will probably bruise a little because of it. So, if you have to have a procedure, discuss your vitamins too. She also told me that it "feels B9". I asked if she could really feel the difference and she said "yes". I will have results by Friday. AWESOME, don't have to go through the weekend wondering. I'll be over in the waiting for results. Sandi

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2009 06:30PM SandiH wrote: Clarice, Crap! Crap! Crap! Thats my favorite word. I just got a call that they needed to change my Biopsy to Wednesday, not Monday. So Clarice, I am still holding your hand and sending you all my thoughts. What time is the appointment and what time zone are you, because I will stop everything and just sit and hold your hand. Take an IPOD with you, listen to some Indie Arie, she's wonderful. We are all in this together. Like you I decided to take a little get away with my daughter and her two little ones to see my other daughter who lives in Phoenix. My thought was being around an 8 year old and three boys under three will keep my mind off things. It has a little. I told my girls yesterday, we believe in honesty and I was feeling I was not being truthful by withholding. Of course, the mommy in me wanted to withhold so that they didn't worry too. But the truth came out, just kept it short, sweet and simple, matter of fact. Kinda like telling them about the birds and the bees, when they were little. I like the idea of two days to find out, but just in case I think I will plan another get away. Ok ladies, I need to say, I find so much comfort in talking to each of you. Talk soon.

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2009 06:58PM SandiH wrote: Hi Clarice and Sheila, Us three holding hands is very, very reassuring to me. OK Sheila, you are our expert here, so I have a question for you. When I had the Mammo and Ultrasound, same day, same office, she was trying to be comforting, saying it is probably nothing to worry about but... I am scheduled for the Needle Biopsy Wed.  Question #1 Is it normal for the Radiologist to do the needle biopsy? You both are scheduled for a Breast Surgeon? She also said, she can't do the spring needle biopsy because it is too close to the rib cage and lung. I kinda got lost in the whole conversation, so didn't ask too many questions, not like me at all, so I will make sure and ask everything that is going through my head next time. #2 Was it painful and if so for how long? Sandi

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 06:21PM SandiH wrote: Clarice, Well crap! Sorry you didn't have your playlist but if it is any comfort, I was thinking about you most of the day yesterday. A Blind Doctor is so much worse than a Blind Ref. Over 8 attempts, what the .... I have my appointment tomorrow, so she better have her game on, cause the number 8 is not happening. OK, all talk, if it has to be 8 so be it, but I won't be coming out a happy camper. And like you, I am mostly a positive person, but also a realist, and any kind of humor is Ok in my book. I don't think it is in their nature to be optimistic, for fear of having to be wrong. No Doctor wants to be wrong, so they are silent, unless provoked to answer. Hummm, I best come up with some questions. What should I ask? After hearing about your ordeal, I think I will reschedule my Dentist appt. I was scheduled for the Biopsy at 11 and the Dentist appt. at 4:00, to finish my crown. So I will call now to reschedule, the crown. Don't worry, I will follow you to the Waiting For Diagnosis place. We're a team now. Sandi
